intro: Galium tricornutum subsp. longipedunculatum, commonly known as the long-pedunculate bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, white or pale green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic, and often have a hairy texture. The subspecies is distinguished by its elongated peduncles, which bear the flower clusters.
